channel.title: Kubeform on Provision cloud resources using Kubernetes CRDs & Terraform

item.title: Acknowledgement | Kubeform
item.description: Acknowledgement Many thanks to HashiCorp for the Terraform project.

item.title: Changelog | Kubeform
item.description: Changelog v0.1.0 (2019-11-05) Kubeform v0.1.0 comes with various features and bug fixes. Please, try it and give us your valuable feedback. To install, please follow the guide here. Significant Features Native Kubernetes Support Standard Kubernetes is all you need. If you can run Kubernetes, you can provision and manage cloud infrastructure using Kubeform. Use standard Kubernetes CLI and API to provision and manage different cloud infrastructures. This native integration with Kubernetes means your cloud infrastructures are ready for any higher level deployment tooling like GitOps, Open Policy Agent (OPA), etc.

item.title: Contributing | Kubeform
item.description: Contribution Guidelines Want to contribute to Kubeform? Getting Help If you have a question about Kubeform or having problem using it, you can contact us on the AppsCode Slack team channel #kubeform. Follow this link to get invitation to our Slack channel. Bugs/Feature request If you have found a bug with Kubeform or want to request for new features, please file an issue. Spread the word If you have written blog post or tutorial on Kubeform, please share it with us on Twitter or Slack.

item.title: Support | Kubeform
item.description: Support If you have found a bug with Kubeform or want to request for new features, please file an issue.

item.title: Welcome | Kubeform
item.description: Kubeform Kubeform by AppsCode is a Kubernetes operator for Terraform. Kubeform provides auto-generated Kubernetes CRDs for Terraform resources and modules so that you can manage any cloud infrastructure in a Kubernetes native way. You just write a CRD for a cloud infrastructure, apply it and Kubeform will create it for you! Kubeform currently supports 5 top cloud platforms. These are AWS, Google Cloud, Azure, Digitalocean and Linode. The key features of Kubeform are:
